title: Mario Balotelli DESTROYS camera after kicking it 'like a football' into advertising hoardings
text:
Mario Balotelli kicked a camera in frustration at being substituted against Genoa on Saturday and the furious owner of it has now said he will make Brescia pay for it.

The incident took place in the second half of Genoa's 3-1 win at the Stadio Luigi Ferraris when Balotelli was substituted for Alfredo Donnarumma after failing to make an impact on the game.

Professional photographer Massimo Lovati had left the camera on a tripod next to the pitch, as he always does, when the eccentric striker kicked the camera in anger.

Mario Balotelli kicked a camera in frustration during Brescia's 3-1 away defeat by Genoa

The photographer took to Instagram after the match to explain what had happened and unleashed a furious rant towards the former Manchester City and Liverpool striker.

'When Mr Balotelli was called back to the bench, he used the camera like a football and kicked it against the advertising boards. The ballboy who saw it happen immediately called me to explain', said Lovati.

'I found the camera and the booster were visibly damaged (the casing was smashed) and the camera no longer worked. Imagine taking your frustrations out on someone's tools of business!'

The photographer said he told Brescia director Edoardo Piovani about the incident and warned he would be sending a bill for repairs to the club.

Massimo Lovati posted photos on Instagram of him looking angry and his damaged camera

'These are very delicate instruments that should not be kicked. It's safe to say I am furious: respect, you need respect for people who are working and their tools of business!!!!', Lovati added.

Balotelli is back playing for his hometown club after rejoining Brescia on a free transfer from Marseille in the summer.

The striker has scored one goal in four appearances since missing the start of the season through suspension.
description: Mario Balotelli (left) kicked a camera in frustration at being substituted against Genoa and the furious owner (right) of it has now said he will make his club Brescia pay for it.
